Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @Flexatron the NXT devs had the same theory, that all the NXT assets were hurting the value of NXT. so they did their best to kill off all the assets

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: at worst, a new KMD assetchain is net neutral as there will be as much funds buying the KMD to buy the new coin as being sold after selling for KMD

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, NXT devs looked at all the selling of NXT that happened with assets that raised NXT. They only looked at half the equation, they didnt look at the funds used to buy the NXT in the first place

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a currency needs to be used

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: buying and selling are usges

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: usage

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and if someone is selling, someone has to be buying

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so anything that creates buying/selling is good for a currency

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and each new ecosystem project brings in a slightly (or dramatically) different set of new peoples, who otherwise wouldnt be in the KMD ecosystem

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you ignore positive effects and only look at negative effects, then i guess you can conclude something negative has happened. but that is not the correct way to assess things

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is the net effect that matters, positive - negative

Author: Flexatron#8809
Content: agreed

Author: Flexatron#8809
Content: thanks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and in an economy, stagnation and inaction is just about the worst thing possible

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
you need this for ZEX.json:
```{
"name": "ZEX",
"symbol": "ZEX",
"algorithm": "equihash",
"txfee": 0.0001,
"peerMagic": "50e39c62",
"disablecb": true
}```

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: i wan't to add the pool setup for assetchains guide in the wiki as well. once we have all these fixes done üòÉ

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and you need the -pubkey set as the pool address ... the pool *should* set the pubkey with `setpubkey` RPC if the pirivate key is imported, but maybe that sometimes fails im not sure... if it was just something I did wrong. although I tested that change heaps of times and it was working properly before.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: so its likely a something ive done trying to get fees working that made it break ...

Content: If I just make it so that "disablecb" option can only have a single rewards address (for pool fee) this would eb very easy ... but to keep it backwards compattible is proving difficult...

Content: Still easier than writing cc validation code inside the stratum though üòÇ
